programme.title: Lives Instead of Knives: one woman's struggle to end knife crime
programme.desc: Smith's Farm Estate in Northolt, north-west London, has been the scene of multiple stabbings. After one murder came particularly close to home, community volunteer Jen Lock began a one-woman mission to end knife crime in the area. But, as she finds out, things don’t always go smoothly.

programme.title: Share
programme.desc: Tim Chau is an 18-year-old Asian-American with more than 4m followers on Instagram. He lives online, grabbing his phone first thing in the morning and even taking baths with it sometimes.

programme.title: The Native American kids who get $200k for graduating
programme.desc: The Ho-Chunk Nation are a Native American tribe that owns a string of casinos across Wisconsin. Ho Chunk children get a share of casino profits once they’ve graduated and turned 18.

programme.title: Behind the scenes on Birmingham derby day with football fans and police
programme.desc: Police on the streets separating rival supporters, cordons restricting access around the ground, holding the away end back after full time: these are familiar experiences for football fans attending derbies up and down the country.

programme.title: 'Revenge pornography': Chrissy Chambers' search for justice
programme.desc: In April, it became a crime in England and Wales to post ‘revenge pornography’. Chrissy Chambers and her girlfriend Bria are YouTube’s most popular lesbian content creators.

programme.title: The Fight
programme.desc: People with disabilities are among the most discriminated against in Bolivia. Fed up with being ignored, a group of them march across the Andes to the seat of the government in La Paz, asking to speak to President Evo Morales. They are met with riot police, barricades, teargas and water cannon.

programme.title: YouTube kids: how unboxing, gaming and toy reviews took over
programme.desc: Being a YouTuber is now the most popular aspiration for children today, according to a survey. In 2018, the site’s highest earner was a seven-year-old American toy reviewer.

programme.title: Saintmaking: the canonisation of Derek Jarman by queer 'nuns'
programme.desc: This year marks the 30th anniversary of film-maker Derek Jarman’s canonisation by an activist group of gay male 'nuns' known as the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence.

programme.title: How to make a pearl
programme.desc: For 53 years, John Kapellas enjoyed the bright sky of the western US, but one day he started to burn, blister and break out in rashes whenever he was exposed to light. Now allergic to the entire spectrum of light, Kapellas has spent the last decade living in complete darkness.

programme.title: Working nights to pack your California strawberries, working days to graduate from school
programme.desc: Ashley Solis is a Mexican American teenager, farmworker and factory worker who dreams of being the first in her family to graduate from high school and go to college. Her mother is undocumented, and like many families with mixed documented status, they face the threat of family separation.

programme.title: Living inside the ruins of my Gaza home | The London ‘hell’ estate fighting back
programme.desc: Why I stay: Living inside the ruins of my Gaza home | The London ‘hell’ estate fighting back: murders, fires and broken lifts

programme.title: This is the NHS
programme.desc: The great British booze problem for the NHS | Knocked down, spat at and trampled on: another day in A&E

programme.title: LGBTQ+ rights
programme.desc: LGBTQ+ rights at The Guardian

programme.title: Meet the artists
programme.desc: Jane and Louise Wilson | Alex Katz

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - The artist and their city
programme.desc: The artist and their city: Ai Weiwei on Beijing: 'It's a prison for freedom of speech' | Antony Gormley: 'London is bought, developed and abandoned'

programme.title: Off The Page
programme.desc: Britain Isn't Eating | Groove is in the Heart | Death of England

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Guardian Cities
programme.desc: Guardian Cities: City champions: 'Make them look twice and think twice' | How we've told the great story of urbanisation

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Guardian Cities
programme.desc: Guardian Cities: Guardian Tokyo week: Fewer wrestlers, more fans - Sumo at a crossroads | Guardian Tokyo week: Salariman rap battle

programme.title: America's soccer migrants: the US footballers crossing Mexico's border
programme.desc: Despite President Donald Trump’s rhetoric about Mexicans crossing the border to the US, American soccer players such as Omar Gonzalez are heading south for new opportunities, more money and a better standard of football.

programme.title: Desert Fire
programme.desc: Football’s world cup for unrecognised territories is viewed through the eyes of the manager and players of one of the most fascinating teams, Iraqi Kurdistan.

programme.title: Can women save sumo? The crossroads facing Japan's national sport
programme.desc: The ancient Japanese sport of sumo is in well-documented crisis. Years of controversy and scandal have hurt the sport's ability to attract new talent.

programme.title: The secret disinformation team who distort reality | Ilya: the AI scientist shaping the world
programme.desc: 'Team Jorge' unmasked: the secret disinformation team who distort reality | Ilya: the AI scientist shaping the world

programme.title: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river
programme.desc: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria: 'We're American, too, why don't they help?' | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river

programme.title: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore
programme.desc: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | 'I'll write as if I'm trying to get sacked': Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore

programme.title: The Night Wolves: Putin's motorbiking militia of Luhansk
programme.desc: The Night Wolves are Russia’s largest and most notorious biker gang, fiercely loyal to Vladimir Putin, and say they are motivated by Christianity and patriotism.

programme.title: Buyers Club
programme.desc: In 2013, a cure was found for hepatitis C. It could save millions of lives, but its price tag of between $40,000 and $84,000 for 84 pills puts it far out of most patients’ reach.

programme.title: Uighur teacher describes forced sterilisation | A survivor recalls India's violent partition
programme.desc: 'The memories never leave me': Uighur teacher describes forced sterilisation | My mother was beheaded in front of me': a survivor recalls India's violent partition

programme.title: Should robots have faces? | Are computers killing the mystery of chess?
programme.desc: Should robots have faces? | Are computers killing the mystery of chess?

programme.title: The Trial
programme.desc: Alka Pradhan, James Connell and Sterling Thomas are lawyers for Ammar al-Baluchi, one of five men facing the death penalty for plotting the 2001 terror attacks in the US.

programme.title: Love Jihad: India's lethal religious conspiracy theory
programme.desc: The mutilated body of a 24-year-old Muslim, Arbaaz Aftab Mullah, was discovered on a railway track near his home.

programme.title: The Gene Gap: Should we edit our DNA? An imagined future of gene editing
programme.desc: There are decisions being made right now that could have an effect on global populations for generations to come. As part of this project, we commissioned an artist to investigate some of the themes raised in the podcasts.

programme.title: ASMR videos that give YouTube viewers 'head orgasms' | Psychology of queues and how to beat them
programme.desc: The ASMR videos that give YouTube viewers 'head orgasms' | After you: the psychology of queues and how to beat them

programme.title: The climate science behind flooding | My animals burned alive' in Greece's wildfires
programme.desc: The climate science behind flooding: why is it getting worse? | My animals burned alive: the man putting his life back together after Greece's wildfires

programme.title: Skyward: birdwatching is belonging for two teenage conservationists
programme.desc: Young birdwatchers Mya and Arjun feel the pressure of climate breakdown and the biodiversity crisis. As two reserved teenagers on the cusp of adulthood, they find comfort in birdwatching while being distant from their peers.

programme.title: Fighting addiction on Pine Ridge reservation
programme.desc: Whiteclay, Nebraska is a tiny unincorporated town that sits on the border with South Dakota.

programme.title: Second innings
programme.desc: From Afghanistan to London, three boys build a new life playing cricket. Tucked away in suburban south London, matches take place every week for young and often traumatised asylum seekers.

programme.title: Qandeel
programme.desc: The life, death and impact of Pakistan’s working-class icon Qandeel Baloch, killed in 2016 after becoming a social media celebrity.

programme.title: Dear Bradford: a love letter to a misunderstood city
programme.desc: From Muslim ‘no-go areas’ to Brexit-voting white nationalists, stereotypes continue to be perpetuated about Bradford 21 years after the 'race riots'.

programme.title: After the riots | From naked protests to challenging Museveni
programme.desc: After the riots: the Muslim women filming everything to stay safe | From naked protests to challenging Museveni: Uganda’s 'rudest feminist' on the campaign trail

programme.title: Right to fight: Martial arts fighter with Down's syndrome
programme.desc: Garrett Holeve (aka G Money) has always dreamt of being a Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter, and with the full support of his parents, prepares to fight another disabled opponent. But Florida authorities deemed the contest a health risk.

programme.title: Dallas Detective agency | Why journalists carry guns in the Philippines
programme.desc: Dallas Detective agency | Why journalists carry guns in the Philippines

programme.title: Inside the strange world of NFTs
programme.desc: Celebrities, sports people, politicians – anyone and everyone seems to be getting into NFTs. These non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have changed the business of buying, selling and owning art and digital property, and 'collectibles' like 'Bored Apes' have sold for millions online.

programme.title: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley
programme.desc: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley: a Native American family's desperate search for their missing relative

programme.title: World Cup Slaves
programme.desc: Nepalese men employed in Qatar's construction industry tell Robert Booth how they work for little or no pay as they build the infrastructure ahead of the 2022 football World Cup.

programme.title: Juste Debout | Stik in Shoreditch
programme.desc: Juste Debout: the world's biggest street-dance competition | Stik in Shoreditch: the artist’s hidden tribute to a sold-off London

programme.title: A love letter to Notting Hill Carnival | Inside New York's underground ballroom scene
programme.desc: A love letter to Notting Hill Carnival | Inside New York's underground ballroom scene: 'It's your chosen family'

programme.title: From California gang to Mexican vigilante | The final interview with a legendary journalist
programme.desc: From California gang to Mexican vigilante: the family man fighting the drug cartels in Mexico | Murdered in Mexico: the final interview with a legendary journalist

programme.title: Gay, black and HIV positive: America's hidden epidemic
programme.desc: If you are a black, gay man in America, your risk of contracting HIV is one in two. Leah Green travels to Atlanta, Georgia, which has the largest gay and black community in the country. She finds out how stigma, education and structural racism continue to feed into this startling statistic

programme.title: Colette
programme.desc: 90-year-old Colette Marin-Catherine confronts her past by visiting the German concentration camp Mittelbau-Dora where her brother was killed. As a young girl, she fought Hitler's Nazis as a member of the French Resistance.

programme.title: America's Dirty Divide
programme.desc: How heat is radically altering Americans' lives before they're even born | Baltimore is burning trash, so we're starving the fire

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Divided Cities
programme.desc: Divided Cities: The last divided capital in Europe | I had no idea hot summers could kill

programme.title: Guardian Australia: My People
programme.desc: In the video series ‘My People’, Guardian Australia explores the peculiar subcultures and niche communities bringing people together across the country. With the breakdown of more traditional communities, these new groups of shared common interests are more important than ever.

programme.title: The case for language learning
programme.desc: Larry Lamb on languages | Are drugs the answer to language learning? | The US farm that teaches Yiddish to the world

programme.title: America's Dirty Divide
programme.desc: The US town swallowed by Big Oil's 'chemical soup' | Why is this majority Black city grappling with 100-year-old sewers?

programme.title: The Cambridge Analytica Files
programme.desc: A year-long investigation into Facebook, data, and influencing elections in the digital age.

programme.title: The year that never ended: how a Ukrainian comedian rebuilt a stranger's house
programme.desc: The Ukrainian comedian Vasyl Baidak sparks an unlikely and enduring friendship with retiree Iryna Terekhova when he joins a group of young people from Kyiv to rebuild her home.

programme.title: Kherson: from heaven of Ukrainian liberation to hell of Russian bombardment
programme.desc: The southern city of Kherson was liberated from Russian occupation in November 2022 by Ukrainian forces, sparking ecstatic scenes in the main square.

programme.title: The Battle for Myanmar’s Buddhist spirit
programme.desc: In Myanmar, different groups of Buddhist monks are battling with how to deal with the country’s minority Muslim population. While some advocate peace, others, such as the extremist Ma Ba Tha, are stoking up hatred and violence.

programme.title: Space to Be: the fight to keep this Belfast women’s centre open
programme.desc: In the heart of the Village, a loyalist area in Belfast, the Windsor Women’s Centre has fought a 30-year battle to keep its doors open. The centre, an oasis for vulnerable women, is deeply rooted in the community.

programme.title: Frozen in Time: the motherhood dilemma for single women in China
programme.desc: Fertility tourism is booming for single Chinese women with hopes of future motherhood.

programme.title: The captain rescuing migrants in the Mediterranean during the Covid-19 pandemic
programme.desc: Savvas Kourepinis is the captain of the Astral, a humanitarian boat patrolling the Mediterranean Sea to rescue people attempting to cross the main maritime route from north Africa to Europe.

programme.title: We swam to Hong Kong for freedom | The Chagos Islanders taking back their birthplace
programme.desc: We swam to Hong Kong for freedom half a century ago. What now?' | The Chagos Islanders taking back their birthplace from the British: 'They uprooted us'

programme.title: The valley rebels
programme.desc: Cédric Herrou is a farmer who supports and houses African refugees in the alpine village of Breil-Sur-Roya in southern France.

programme.title: The Breadmaker: Venezuelan activists fighting to feed a community
programme.desc: Natalia Molina and other members of La Minka, a Chavista collective, run a revolutionary bakery in the Venezuelan capital. They have been occupying the shop in Caracas since March 2017 in an attempt to provide their local community with affordable food.

programme.title: I came out as HIV positive to break down stigma | Staged Sex: Role of the Intimacy Co-Ordinator
programme.desc: Lloyd Russell-Moyle tells Owen Jones: 'I came out as HIV positive to break down stigma' | Staged Sex: Role of the Intimacy Co-Ordinator

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.sub-title: S07 : E04 Taaaki karp! S7 Ep4
programme.desc: Neil i Tom kończą siódmą serię programu nad jeziorem, w którym żyją największe karpie królewskie na naszej planecie. To tutaj, w ośrodku Euro Aqua na Węgrzech, padły wszystkie ostatnie rekordy świata.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep10
programme.desc: W stanie Iowa dochodzi do problemów przy budowie wieży ciśnień; w Pittsburghu autostrada niszczy budynki mieszkalne; w Wielkiej Brytanii projekt autostrady okazuje się bardzo niebezpieczny.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Po stu latach ciągłego kopania, dziewicza ziemia jest rzadkością na terenie Gemfields; Rowan Richardson chce sprawdzić nową działkę — i wykopuje dużo więcej, niż się spodziewał!

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E07 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep7
programme.desc: Steve Grahame zabiera swojego nowego psa, Bellę, w długą drogę do Alice Springs. Zespół Nitro Funny Cars pędzi 3 tys. km przez Australię, aby zdążyć na jedno z największych dorocznych wydarzeń.

programme.title: Drewno z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Ekipa z firmy Duz Cho Logging ma tylko kilka dni na ukończenie zimowego wyrębu, zanim wiosenna odwilż zniszczy drogę. Niestety, gigantyczna dziura w ziemi zatrzymuje produkcję i powoduje chaos.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S3 Ep5
programme.desc: To wyjtkowo trudny czas dla caej floty. Kuter William Norling jest na morzu ju od tygodnia, a jego kapitan Danny nadal nie znalaz kupca na 1000 kilogramw homarw.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.sub-title: S07 : E04 Taaaki karp! S7 Ep4
programme.desc: Neil i Tom kończą siódmą serię programu nad jeziorem, w którym żyją największe karpie królewskie na naszej planecie. To tutaj, w ośrodku Euro Aqua na Węgrzech, padły wszystkie ostatnie rekordy świata.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Zbliża się czas przebudowy furgonetki marki Divco, ale Bill ma poważny problem, który może zagrozić rywalizacji.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S3 Ep10
programme.desc: W stanie Iowa dochodzi do problemów przy budowie wieży ciśnień; w Pittsburghu autostrada niszczy budynki mieszkalne; w Wielkiej Brytanii projekt autostrady okazuje się bardzo niebezpieczny.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia

programme.title: Drewno z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S3 Ep5
programme.desc: To wyjtkowo trudny czas dla caej floty. Kuter William Norling jest na morzu ju od tygodnia, a jego kapitan Danny nadal nie znalaz kupca na 1000 kilogramw homarw.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.desc: W Chorwacji można spotkać jedne z największych karpi na świecie — i jest ich całe mnóstwo! Nie ma lepszego miejsca do łowienia karpi niż jezioro Zajarki na obrzeżach Zagrzebia.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Glen i Bill uruchamiają firmę Wreckless Restorations, ale spierają się o terminy. Peter i Jason podejmują się odbudowy maszyny pokrytej błotem, której czyszczenie nie idzie tak dobrze, jak oczekiwali.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Mifsudowie szybko orientują się, że wydobywanie szafirów jest bardzo trudnym zajęciem. Ray i Paul używają swojej 40-tonowej wiertnicy, aby dokopać się do starych tuneli.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E08 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep8
programme.desc: Mackay House Movers wykonują jedno ze swoich największych zleceń w historii firmy. Steve Grahame przeżywa koszmar w drodze przez równinę Nullarbor: ma problemy z wynajętym kierowcą i z własnym psem.

programme.title: Drewno z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Jest pełnia lata; firma Integrated Operations przechodzi do ostatniej fazy swojej operacji: załadunku drewna o wartości czterech milionów dolarów na gigantyczną barkę.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S3 Ep6
programme.desc: Kuter rodziny Jagerów stoi uziemiony w porcie od czterech miesięcy, jego kapitan Glenn stracił już 260 tys. dolarów przychodu. Squizzy ma cztery dni na uzupełnienie zapasów.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E01 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep1
programme.desc: W Kalifornii dochodzi do katastrofy, w wyniku której na jednym z najważniejszych skrzyżowań w Ameryce rozpętuje się piekło. Dlaczego rutynowa rozbiórka w Canberze przerodziła się w tragedię?

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia

programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S3 Ep6

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.desc: Jeśli tym razem Neil i Tom mają odnieść sukces, będą musieli przechytrzyć karpia i zmagać się z trudnymi warunkami pogodowymi podczas wyprawy nad ogromne dzikie jezioro w RPA.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Peter i Jason ścigają się z czasem, chcąc zaskoczyć Audrey i odrestaurować jej ukochaną corvette. Wreckless Restorations ryzykuje, zatrudniając nowego pracownika, aby rozwinąć swoją działalność.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Potężne powodzie i małe tornado prawie sparaliżowały prace na terenie Gemfields. Z drugiej strony wreszcie pojawiła się tak potrzebna woda, a niewielkie zniszczenia nie powstrzymają zapału górników.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E09 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep9
programme.desc: Mark Cromwell i jego zespół podejmują się największej misji w historii. Niedawno zalane drogi sprawiają kłopoty Steve'owi Grahame'owi. Mick King przewozi 15-miesięczną żyrafę do nowego domu.

programme.title: Drewno z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Po dwóch miesiącach przerwy firma Freya Logging wraca na teren letniego wyrębu, który może być zamknięty z powodu pożaru. Niestety, zaawansowane technologicznie maszyny sprawiają problemy...

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S3 Ep7
programme.desc: Na pokładzie Williama Norlinga napięcie osiąga punkt krytyczny. Marynarz Macca popełnia dramatyczny błąd. Bryce mierzy się z potężnym sztormem. Jay dostaje zamówienie do zrealizowania w 11 godzin.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep2
programme.desc: W Arizonie dochodzi do cudownej ucieczki, kiedy katastrofa kolejowa niszczy ważną przeprawę przez rzekę. W centrum Los Angeles w Kalifornii nowatorski projekt sali koncertowej zwiastuje kłopoty.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Potężne powodzie i małe tornado prawie sparaliżowały prace na terenie Gemfields. Z drugiej strony wreszcie pojawiła się tak potrzebna woda, a niewielkie zniszczenia nie powstrzymają zapału górników.
